title: Social Media - MozMoz logoMenu openMenu closeSearchMoz logo
description: Your all-in-one suite of SEO essentials.
content: By: Rand Fishkin January 31, 2007 SEOmoz's First Video - A Roundtable Discussion on Wikipedia Social Media We recently bought a video camera and played around yesterday with some video shooting. Luckily, Scott, our resident former-Hollywooder, was able to convert the video into something we can put on the blog: ... Read this post By: Jane Copland January 9, 2007 Web 2.0 Awards, Version 2.0 Social Media I would start this post with the customary "I'm sorry for using the phrase Web 2.0" apology, but everyone who's ever used the term has already groveled to the 2.0 haters. It's that time of year again, folks. I have been charged with organizing the second annual Web 2.0 Awards.Last year, the Awards began as little more than a pet pro... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin January 3, 2007 Reddit is by Far the Better Choice for Readers, but Digg Remains the Holy Grail for Viral Marketing Social Media With predictions of Digg's fall this year rampant in 2006 roundup posts, I figured I'd jump in and give my $0.02. #1 - Digg will remain popular with their de... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin November 30, 2006 The Two Kinds of Linkbait Social Media Recently, I've begun to see massive problems in the search and online community's definitions of linkbait. It boils down to two completely unique meanings for the term: Linkbait Definition #1 - "Link-Worthy, Linkerati-Targeted Content"This is the way I typically use the term linkbait. It refers to a piece of content one creates (for one's own site or ano... Read this post By: Rebecca Kelley October 27, 2006 How to Get Banned From Digg Social Media These days it seems like everyone's written an article or blog entry on all things digg, e.g. why you shouldn't game digg, digg etiquette, whether digg is rigged. Jeff and I thought we'd join the bandwagon and off... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin October 17, 2006 A Piece of Content that Doesn't Deserve to be Linkbait Social Media Either someone at the Web Advertising Blog is gaming the social media sites, or the bar on quality has dropped to fantastically low levels. Making its debut on Digg and del.icio.us/popular today was this absolute stinker - ... Read this post By: Rebecca Kelley September 28, 2006 Is Social Networking a Dotcom Bubble Waiting to Burst? Social Media Although I'm up to my ears in projects and deadlines, I felt compelled to blog about an article at Slate Magazine titled "$1 Billion for Facebook? LOL!" The article questions whether the current social marketing mania shares eerie similarities to the late dotcom bubble:The Dow's at a record high, youthful entrepreneurs ... Read this post J By: Jeff Pollard September 16, 2006 Wikipedia Forks in to...Citizendium? Social Media As posted on way too many blogs to count, Wikipedia co-founder Larry Sanger has decided to fork Wikipedia in to a new project called Citizendium. I know, I had no idea what it was either. Luckily, their "website&qu... Read this post By: Rebecca Kelley September 12, 2006 Wikipedia vs. Britannica in a No-Holds-Barred Debate Social Media The Wall Street Journal online hosted a debate between Wikipedia founder Jimmy Wales and Dale Hoiberg, the editor-in-chief of Encyclopaedia Britannica. I've included a brief excerpt (in which Jimmy Wales lays the smackdown on Dale Hoiberg) below:... Read this post E By: Ella_D August 30, 2006 The Digg Effect on an Alpha Website: GigaSize Social Media Today, we jumped off our chairs when we realized what had just happened. One of the major platforms that we are developing, Gigasize, was dugg today... and I can assure you it was totally unplanned. We were in alpha phase, testing out functionalities, improving usability, etc., and then BOOM... thousands and thousands of visitors, peaking ... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin August 29, 2006 Social Media Marketing, eh? Let's See What's in Our Bag o' Goodies. Social Media Danny's hoping that I'll post something on social media optimization marketing and it's hard to let a soon-to-be-unemployed man down (too soon?). Thus, I give you my version of an introduction to the social media space - what's important, what's worth your time and how to go about working the SMO... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin August 16, 2006 StumbleUpon's Fantastic Ability to Drive Traffic Social Media I've been a fan of StumbleUpon for almost 6 months, and here's why: The above image shows the traffic stats from the StumbleUpon toolbar to SEOmoz since the beginning of the year. Wh... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin August 2, 2006 The Word - Wikiality (Courtesy of Mr. Colbert) Social Media Oilman pointed to this first, so he deserves the link credit. Bravo, Todd - your taste in entertainment makes me an even bigger fan than before. Like Todd, I watched this segment last night and couldn't help but think how plugged in Colbert's staff must be to the Web 2.0 world. Unlike so many parodies of Internet t... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin July 27, 2006 A Simple Explanation for Why MySpace is So Successful Social Media For nearly 2 years now, online and offline media has been obsessed with the success of MySpace, the social networking website that caters primarily to teenage and young adult demographics. Explanations for the phenomenal growth in traffic, page views per session, membership explosion and brandshare have been attributed to everything from the ... Read this post
